classes.name: Activity
classes.description: A table describing the activities performed on biosamples or files that resulted in the generation of additional files. The anvil_activity table is used to capture activity provenance that does not fit into the other activity tables described in the schema (such as file indexing, file checksums, etc.).
classes.label: Activity

attributes.label: Activity Type
attributes.description: A reference to the type of activity, preferably using an identifier in a recommended standard ontology.

classes.name: BioSample
classes.description: Contains information about the sample(s) included in the dataset.
classes.label: BioSample

attributes.label: Anatomical Site
attributes.description: A human-readable reference to the site within the organism from which the biosample was taken.

attributes.label: BioSample Id
attributes.description: A unique identifier for the biosample.

attributes.label: BioSample Type
attributes.description: A human-readable reference to the type of biosample represented by the record.

classes.name: Dataset
classes.description: A dataset is a collection of related files and associated metadata that share the same consent and access permissions.
classes.label: Dataset

attributes.label: Access
attributes.description: Indicates whether the user has permission to access the given dataset. For open-access datasets, this value will always be "Granted". For controlled-access datasets, it will be "Required" if the user is not logged in. If the user is logged in, the value will reflect their specific access permissions for the dataset.

attributes.label: Access
attributes.description: Indicates whether the user has permission to access the given dataset. For open-access datasets, this value will always be "Granted". For controlled-access datasets, it will be "Required" if the user is not logged in. If the user is logged in, the value will reflect their specific access permissions for the dataset.

attributes.label: Consent Group
attributes.description: Consent group or consent groups related to a dataset.

attributes.label: Registered Identifier
attributes.description: Unique ID used to identify this dataset in an external database. For example, the DUOS identifier for datasets registered in DUOS.

attributes.label: Title
attributes.description: A human-readable property that identifies the dataset which the dataset belongs to.

attributes.label: Diagnosis
attributes.description: A human-readable property that identifies a disease or condition has been reported in this entity.

classes.name: Diagnosis
classes.description: Contains information about conditions or diagnoses related to the donor of a biosample.
classes.label: Diagnosis

attributes.label: Diagnosis
attributes.description: A human-readable property that identifies a disease or condition has been reported in this entity.

classes.name: Donor
classes.description: Demographic and phenotypic information about the donor.
classes.label: Donor

attributes.label: Donor Id
attributes.description: A unique identifier for the donor.

attributes.label: Organism Type
attributes.description: A human-readable reference to the organism type.

attributes.label: Phenotypic Sex
attributes.description: A reference to the BiologicalSex of the Donor organism. "An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's physical expression of sexual characteristics. [PATO_0001894]

attributes.label: Reported Ethnicity
attributes.description: A property that relects a Human Donor's reported ethnic origins. Note this may contain both Race and Ethnicity information as define by the US Department of Interior (DOI) https://www.doi.gov/pmb/eeo/directives/race-data

classes.name: File
classes.description: Information for files associated with the dataset.
classes.label: File

attributes.label: DRS URI
attributes.description: A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that follows the GA4GH Data Repository Service (DRS) specification. It provides a standardized way to reference and access digital objects, such as files, within compliant data repositories. The DRS URI enables interoperability across systems by allowing authorized users and tools to retrieve dataset contents through a consistent interface.

attributes.label: File Format
attributes.description: An indication of the format of an electronic file; include the full file extension including compression extensions. Usually aligns with file extension (e.g. bam, sam, text, csv, etc.)

attributes.label: File Name
attributes.description: The name of the file.

attributes.label: File Size
attributes.description: Size of file in megabytes.
